title: Feature Engineering
text:
About this Project
As part of the BSA Tennis Consulting Club at UCLA, I have taken on some other projects on top of my responsibilities as a tagging team lead and analyst. One of these projects is the feature engineering project. As the club has begun to transition to AI systems for data creation, some features are not readily available with the software the club utilises, warranting feature engineering of said features. More on this project can be seen [here].

title: Relevant Courses
text:
Practice of Statistical Consulting
Statistical Models for Finance
Introduction to Computation and Optimisation for Statistics
Introduction to Data Analysis Regression

title: Comparative Study on Tire Performance
text: The Comparative Study on Tire Performance was a study done for the STATS 140XP final project. This study looked at publicly available data from IMSA, specifically the Lamborghini Supertrofeo North America cup, to determine if one tire brand performs better than the other. For as long as this category of racing existed, tires have been distributed by Pirelli. However, the beginning of the 2023 season marked the beginning of a new era with all cars across this category switching to Hankook tires. This study aimed to determine which of the two tires performed better. More on this study can be found [here].

title: Insights to IPV Website
text:
The Insights to IPV website was created as a part of the Digital Humanities 101 Course at UCLA using Wordpress. The goal of creating this website was to raise awareness on gender inequality, specifically intimate partner violence. Through this website, my team and I aimed to answer multiple research questions while informing potential solutions to current problems faced in this field.

The creation of this site required data collection, data cleaning, data analyses (and visualisations), and literature review. Find out more by visiting the site here.

title: Faith Satrya
text:
Hi there!
My name is Faith Satrya, I am a recent graduate of the Statistics and Data Science B.S. program at UCLA. My studies have enhanced my interest in being able to perform data analyses in many different contexts to inform solutions. I currently work part-time as a tennis instructor, specialising in teaching children between the ages of 5-14. While incredibly passionate about this job, I am currently looking for full-time employment in a field where I can apply the skills I obtained during my time at UCLA.

(if the link on the left is not working, find my resume here)
